Hackintosh solution to disabled tilde and backtick.

12 June 2011

When you’re doing Â work in the terminal or doing programming work, you use these two characters quite a lot. It is habitual to just type ~ and get the home directly. After hackintoshin’ my new laptop I lost those keys. Here’s the fix:

The fix is a new keyboard layout (like a foreign language keyboard layout) custom-made by a guy Jopari on myhpmini.com forums. A download link is provided at the end of this post. Here are his original instructions for installing it:

Unzip it and stick HP Mini.keylayout in ~/Library/Keyboard Layouts or /Library/Keyboard Layouts (if you want it to be available across all user accounts). Reboot your computer and then open System Preferences -> International -> Input Menu. Select “HP Mini”; the Input menu should appear on your menu bar. Select “HP Mini” from the input menu and you should be in business (you can then remove the input source menu from your menu bar if you’d like).

Download: HP Mini.keylayout.zip
